header.title: Il Grand Grimoire con La Grande Clavicola di Salomone

central_thesis: The text presents itself as the ultimate grimoire, revealing the true and most potent methods for commanding infernal spirits, discovering hidden treasures, and achieving various magical feats through precise rituals, invocations using divine names, and binding pacts, largely attributed to the legendary wisdom of King Solomon.

structure_content.summary: The E-Book editor describes a personal journey into the occult, the discovery of a rare 1421 translation of the Grand Grimoire by J. Karter Venetiana, and the decision to digitize this 'infamous and blasphemous text of black magic' to make its contents accessible, while acknowledging assistants Iosephus and Kadathon for their help.

structure_content.chapter_title: LE GRAND GRIMOIRE, AVEC LA GRANDE CLAVICULE DE SALOMON (French Title Page)
structure_content.summary: This section reiterates the primary title and provides a subtitle that explicitly links the work to 'Black Magic,' 'Infernal Forces of Grand Agrippa,' and their application for discovering hidden treasures and compelling spirits to obey, encompassing a wide range of 'magical arts'.

The preface asserts the extraordinary power and rarity of the grimoire, claiming it compresses the essence of over twenty volumes. It challenges skepticism by stating the 'philosophical operations' are entirely practicable if instructions are followed precisely, citing the life of St. Cyprian as a historical precedent for such practices.

This chapter underscores the profound rarity and value of the Grand Grimoire, presenting it as originating from the writings of King Solomon, who reputedly mastered and compelled spirits through the power of his 'talisman, or clavicle,' revealing potent 'fulminant words' for their command.

A stern warning against audacity (temerità) in approaching this profound magical science is given, emphasizing the absolute necessity of strict adherence to all instructions. It introduces the 'fulminant rod' as a pivotal tool, highlighting its divine origin and power, capable of controlling spirits and even natural phenomena like clouds and storms, echoing its use by God's angel and for punishing rebellious angels.

Detailed instructions are provided for the creation and consecration of the 'Mysterious or Fulminant Rod.' This includes specifying the material (wild hazelnut without fruit), its precise length (19.5 inches), forked shape, and the ritualistic cutting at sunrise with a knife previously used for animal sacrifice. The rod is imbued with power through invocations to figures like Jacob, Moses, Joshua, Samson, Emmanuel, and Zariatnatmick. Further steps involve arming its forked tips with steel from the sacrificial knife and magnetizing them with a lodestone, accompanied by specific invocations to integrate all desired forces.

This chapter outlines the meticulous construction of the 'Great Cabalistic Circle,' which serves as both a protective and operative space. It involves using a goat skin fastened with four nails, drawing a triangle and specific letters with an amatita stone, and inscribing the holy name of Jesus (†JHS†) for protection against malicious spirits. The setup requires two consecrated candles, vervain crowns, a vessel of willow charcoal, wine spirit, frankincense, and camphor, all used by the Karcist (operator) and assistants while reciting an initial offering prayer.

This is a preparatory prayer to Adonay, Eloim, and Jehova, invoking them as the 'great and powerful Adonay' and 'Lord of all spirits,' seeking their favor and acceptance for the ritual. It emphasizes the importance of a 'quarter of the moon' period of purification, including dietary restrictions and celibacy, with specific meal times and prayers.

Prior to the main operation, the practitioner must undergo a 'quarter of the moon' purification period, abstaining from sexual contact, eating only two meals a day at specific times, and reciting a prayer to Adonay, Eloim, and Jehova before each meal to ensure purity and favor for the impending magical work. Instructions for acquiring and carrying an amatita stone for protection are also given, as spirits will attempt to distract the Karcist.

Details the ritualistic sacrifice of a virgin kid/goat. After scanning the animal, its skin is removed, and the remains are burned to ash. The ashes are then collected and scattered towards the rising sun, accompanied by specific invocations to Adonay, Eloim, Ariel, and Jehova, acknowledging the sacrifice and requesting acceptance of the ashes. The goat skin is preserved to form the 'cabalistic circle'.

A solemn prayer addressed to the living God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit), expressing deep adoration, submission, and belief in God as the Creator and sustainer. It affirms the practitioner's complete dedication to God's will for eternity, seeking protection and divine favor.

A direct appeal to God, the creator of humanity, to grant favor and prevent 'rebellious spirits' from withholding 'treasures.' The prayer specifically invokes divine names like Adonay, Eloim, Ariel, Jehova, and Tagla Mathon, asking for the power to possess these temporal riches through the words of the 'clavicle'.

An offering of 'the purest frankincense' is made to Adonay, Eloim, Ariel, and Jehova, seeking their acceptance and success in the 'great undertaking.' It reinforces the intent to obtain power and achieve the magical objectives.

structure_content.chapter_title: PRIMA CHIAMATA ALL'IMPERATORE LUCIFERO (First Call to Emperor Lucifer)
structure_content.summary: This is the initial, powerful invocation directly commanding Emperor Lucifer, ruler of rebellious spirits, to appear or send his messenger, Astaroth. It uses the authority of God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit) and threatens torment with the 'fulminant rod' if Lucifer disobeys, demanding his appearance without noise or foul odors to answer questions 'article by article'.

A reiteration of the command to Lucifer, intensifying the threat of eternal torment using the 'fulminant rod' and the 'potent words of the clavicle.' It invokes the power of God, Emmanuel (Lucifer's son and master), and the virtue of His precious blood, ordering Lucifer to appear or send Astaroth in human form without sound or stench, or face immediate percussion with the rod into the abyss.

This warning instructs the Karcist that if the spirit does not appear after the second call, the clavicle must be read again while striking the ground with the two forked points of the 'fulminant rod' placed in fire. It reassures the operator not to be afraid of 'frightful screams' or noises, as these indicate the spirits' imminent appearance.

The final, most forceful command to Emperor Lucifer, invoking God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit) and divine names (Adonay, Eloim, Ariel, Jehova) to compel his immediate appearance or the sending of Astaroth. It explicitly threatens repeated striking with the 'fulminant rod' upon Lucifer and his associates if he fails to manifest instantly. If still no appearance, the rod's points are placed in fire again.

structure_content.chapter_title: GRANDE CHIAMATA DEL GRAN CABALISTICO (Great Call of the Grand Cabalistic)
structure_content.summary: This is a comprehensive adjuration, compelling the spirit to appear 'at this moment' through a vast array of divine and magical names: Adonay, Eloim, Ariel, Jehova, Agla, Tagla, Mathon, Oarios, Almouzin, Arios, Membrot, Varios, Pithona, Magots, Salphae, Gabots, Salamandra, Tabots, Gnomus, Terra, Coelis, Godend, Aqua, Guingua, Jauna, Etitnamus, Zariatnatmick, and numerous others. It is repeated twice to ensure the spirit's appearance.

structure_content.chapter_title: DELL'APPARIZIONE DELLO SPIRITO (Of the Spirit's Appearance)
structure_content.summary: Upon successful evocation, the spirit, identified as Lucifuge Rofocale, appears and questions why his rest is being disturbed, asking for the demand. This signals the transition from conjuration to direct communication.

structure_content.chapter_title: DOMANDA ALLO SPIRITO (Question to the Spirit)
structure_content.summary: The Karcist (Solomon) directly commands the spirit (Lucifuge Rofocale) to 'make me rich as soon as possible,' threatening to torment him eternally with the 'potent words of the clavicle' if the demand is not met.

Lucifuge Rofocale initially refuses the demand for riches unless the practitioner agrees to surrender their body and soul to him 'from now to fifty years' for his pleasure. This sets the Faustian condition for the pact.

structure_content.chapter_title: DIMANDA ALLO SPIRITO (Demand to the Spirit - Repeated)
structure_content.summary: The Karcist (Solomon) reiterates the threat, stating, 'I will strike you and all your company by the power of the great Adonay, if you do not grant me what I demand immediately.' This continues the pressure on the spirit to concede.

This instruction advises the Karcist to continue placing the tips of the 'fulminant rod' into fire and rereading the 'great call of the clavicle' until the spirit fully submits to the practitioner's desires, indicating the persistent use of force to compel obedience.

structure_content.chapter_title: RISPOSTA E CONVENZIONE DELLO SPIRITO (Spirit's Response and Agreement)
structure_content.summary: Lucifuge Rofocale relents to the Karcist's demands, agreeing to appear and provide treasures for two hours nightly on specific days (Monday 9 PM/Midnight, Tuesday 10 PM/1 AM, Wednesday 11 PM/2 AM, Thursday 8 PM/10 PM, Friday 7 PM/Midnight, Saturday 9 PM/11 PM). He also approves the Karcist's book and provides his signature on parchment to be included, promising a coin on the first days of each month, in exchange for Solomon's acceptance of these terms.

structure_content.chapter_title: RISPOSTA ALLO SPIRITO (Response to the Spirit)
structure_content.summary: Solomon accepts Lucifuge Rofocale's conditions, signifying the completion of the pact negotiation and the spirit's submission.

structure_content.chapter_title: SCONGIURAZIONE E RINVIO DELLO SPIRITO (Conjuration and Dismissal of the Spirit)
structure_content.summary: The Karcist expresses satisfaction with Lucifuge Rofocale's compliance and grants him leave to depart to his chosen abode, with the strict warning to cause no disturbance and to remember his promises, reiterating the threat of eternal torment with the 'fulminant rod' should he fail. This effectively closes the ritual.

structure_content.chapter_title: PREGHIERA ALL' ONNIPOTENTE IN RENDIMENTO DI GRAZIE (Prayer to the Almighty in Thanksgiving)
structure_content.summary: A prayer of gratitude to God for allowing the pact to be formed without danger and for the granted favors. It expresses humility and acknowledges God's power, asking for continued inspiration of charity to help the poor with the newfound riches, emphasizing the divine permission for these operations.

structure_content.chapter_title: SECONDO LIBRO contenente IL SANCTUM REGUM DELLA CLAVICOLA OSSIA (Second Book containing The Sanctum Regum of the Clavicle, or)
structure_content.summary: This section introduces the 'True Way to Make Pacts with Any Spirit Without Harm,' clarifying that it is essential for those who wish to compel spirits but lack the necessary 'qualities' to prepare the 'fulminant rod' and 'cabalistic circle' as described earlier. It promises to reveal methods for obtaining treasures, understanding hidden thoughts, controlling weather, achieving invisibility, and gaining knowledge of natural sciences through these pacts.

structure_content.chapter_title: IN SEGUITO ALTRI SEGRETI MAGICI (Following Other Magical Secrets)
structure_content.summary: This subtitle introduces a collection of miscellaneous magical practices and recipes that follow the core grimoire operations, offering a variety of practical applications beyond spirit evocation and pact-making.

structure_content.chapter_title: Names of Infernal Spirits and Their Powers
structure_content.summary: This section details the hierarchy of infernal spirits, starting with the primary triumvirate: Lucifer (Emperor), Belzebuth (Prince), and Astaroth (Grand Duke). It then lists six 'superior spirits'—Lucifuge Rofocale, Satanachia, Agagliarept, Fleurèty, Sargatanas, and Nebiros—each with specific command over 18 subordinate spirits. The individual powers of these superior spirits are described, covering riches, control over individuals, revealing secrets, influencing weather, invisibility, necromancy, and causing harm or finding the 'hand of glory'.

This section provides critical preparatory instructions for forming pacts with the principal spirits. It outlines the ritualistic cutting of a wild hazelnut rod at sunrise, the use of an amatita stone to draw a specific triangle (only for the first pact), and the placement of blessed candles. It also notes that the spirit's ability to transport treasure eliminates the need for the practitioner to travel, and stresses the importance of chastity and divorce from worldly attachments before performing these pacts.

structure_content.chapter_title: GRANDE CHIAMATA PER FAR VENIRE LO SPIRITO COL QUALE SI VUOL FARE IL PATTO ESTRATTA DALLA GRANDE CLAVICOLA (Great Call to Make the Spirit with Whom One Wishes to Make a Pact Appear, Extracted from the Grand Clavicle)
structure_content.summary: This is a specific, potent invocation directly addressing Emperor Lucifer, Prince Belzebuth, and Count Astaroth, beseeching them to send Lucifuge Rofocale. The purpose is to establish a pact for riches, and the invocation leverages the full authority of God and numerous divine names (Aglon, Tetagram, cay-cheon, etc.) while threatening extreme torment for disobedience, ensuring the spirit's prompt and visible appearance to negotiate the pact.

structure_content.chapter_title: APPARIZIONE DELLO SPIRITO (Appearance of the Spirit - Second Book)
structure_content.summary: Similar to the first book, upon successful invocation, Lucifuge Rofocale manifests and expresses his displeasure at being disturbed, again prompting the operator to state their demand. This signifies the opening of dialogue for the pact formation in this section of the text.

structure_content.chapter_title: DIMANDA ALLO SPIRITO (Demand to the Spirit - Second Book)
structure_content.summary: The practitioner reiterates the demand for immediate wealth from Lucifuge Rofocale, explicitly threatening the spirit with further torment using the 'potent words of the clavicle' if the riches are not promptly granted, maintaining assertive control over the interaction.

structure_content.chapter_title: RISPOSTA DELLO SPIRITO (Spirit's Reply - Second Book)
structure_content.summary: Lucifuge Rofocale responds with a conditional offer: he will provide the requested treasure if the practitioner consecrates a coin to him. This marks a new negotiation point, implying a less severe demand than the previous request for body and soul.

structure_content.chapter_title: RISPOSTA ALLO SPIRITO (Response to the Spirit - Second Book)
structure_content.summary: The practitioner accepts the spirit's condition regarding the consecrated coin and the offer of nearby treasure. This confirms the agreement on the pact terms, which also include specific visitation times and a clause about the practitioner's soul if the promises are broken over twenty years.

structure_content.chapter_title: SCONGIURAZIONE E LICENZIAMENTO DELLO SPIRITO COL QUALE SI È FATTO IL PATTO (Conjuration and Dismissal of the Spirit with Whom the Pact Has Been Made)
structure_content.summary: After the pact is sealed, the practitioner expresses satisfaction and dismisses Lucifuge Rofocale, allowing him to return to his dwelling without noise or foul odor. A final warning is issued, reminding the spirit of his promises and the consequence of eternal torment by the 'fulminant rod' if the pact is broken.

structure_content.chapter_title: PREGHIERA ALL' ONNIPOTENTE IN RENDIMENTO DI GRAZIE (Prayer to the Almighty in Thanksgiving - Second Book)
structure_content.summary: A prayer of profound gratitude to God for creating all things for humanity's benefit and for allowing the pact with the rebellious spirit without risk. It seeks divine inspiration for charity and the ability to share the acquired wealth, recognizing all blessings as coming from God.

structure_content.chapter_title: CITATIO PRAEDICTORUM SPIRITUM (§ I, § II, § III, § IV)
structure_content.summary: These four sections contain Latin invocations essential for commanding and controlling spirits. They invoke the Holy Trinity and Christ's divine power, compelling spirits to appear, answer truthfully, and obey commands without causing harm. These texts also ensure protection for the operator's body, soul, and possessions, emphasizing the supreme authority used to bind infernal entities.

structure_content.chapter_title: IL SEGRETO MAGICO OSSIA L'ARTE DI PARLARE COI MORTI (The Magical Secret, or The Art of Speaking with the Dead)
structure_content.summary: This section describes a necromantic ritual for communicating with the deceased. It involves attending midnight mass on Christmas, then proceeding to a cemetery, scattering earth from a grave, and using two bones of the dead, along with specific invocations, to compel the shade to appear and provide information.

A collection of various standalone magical operations, including instructions for creating a divining rod (bacchetta divinatoria), enchanting firearms (armi da fuoco) for protection, rendering oneself insensible to torture, preparing the 'Composition of Death' (misleadingly titled, as it describes making the Philosopher's Stone for gold transmutation), speaking with spirits on St. John the Baptist's Eve, causing people to dance naked, achieving invisibility, gaining favor from judges, and hardening oneself against weapons.

Detailed instructions for constructing a divinatory mirror (specchio di Salomone) over 48 days (or sometimes 14 days), starting at the new moon. The process involves polishing a steel plate, inscribing divine names with dove's blood, and performing specific invocations to the angel Anael. The mirror is intended to reveal hidden knowledge and answer questions.

This section provides various love spells. One involves a gold ring set with a diamond, consecrated with specific words and carried close to the heart, incorporating hairs from both individuals. Another, the 'Pomo d'amore' (love apple) ritual, involves writing names, combining hairs, and baking an apple to be placed under the desired person's pillow, all designed to induce affection.

A list of common superstitions and omens, distinguishing between those perceived as bad luck (e.g., encountering a priest in the morning, a black cat, spilled salt, a dog facing the door while sleeping) and good luck (e.g., meeting a baker with bread, a huntress, receiving a compliment).

This final section contains a variety of folk remedies and medicinal recipes for common ailments, including pleurisy, pneumonia, fever, burns, coughs, head contusions, tonsillitis, boils, contagious diseases, venomous bites, mouth sores, abscesses, colic, kidney stones, and deafness. These are practical health applications, distinct from the occult rituals.

key_concepts.definition: The central text itself, presented as the most potent and 'infamous' manual for black magic and spirit evocation, often drawing from or claiming derivation from the Clavicle of Solomon.
Referenced as the source of many powerful words, invocations, and methods for compelling and binding infernal spirits, implying a lineage of Solomonic magic.

A magically consecrated hazelnut rod, 19.5 inches long, forked, and tipped with steel. It is imbued with divine power and sacrificial blood, serving as the primary tool to strike, compel, and command spirits into obedience.

A meticulously constructed protective and operative space, typically drawn on goat skin and fastened with nails. It incorporates divine names (e.g., †JHS†) and symbols (a triangle, specific letters drawn with amatita) to contain and control evoked spirits, ensuring the Karcist's safety.

Formal agreements made between the Karcist and infernal spirits (notably Lucifuge Rofocale) for material gain (e.g., hidden treasures), invisibility, or other desires. These pacts often involve a contractual period and a symbolic exchange, sometimes hinting at the practitioner's soul or a consecrated coin.

The designated operator or magician responsible for performing the rituals, making the invocations, and negotiating with the spirits. The role demands strict adherence to ritual, courage, and a state of purification.
A 'bloodstone' used specifically for drawing magical symbols and lines within the cabalistic circle and for general protection during operations. It is mentioned as a protective amulet against fear.

Powerful sacred names (e.g., Adonay, Eloim, Jehova, Ariel, Tagla Mathon, Agla, Tetagram, etc.) invoked during conjurations. Despite summoning infernal spirits, these names are used to assert divine authority and compel the demons to appear and obey.

A prominent infernal spirit, identified as the Prime Minister to Emperor Lucifer. He is the principal entity with whom pacts are made for the acquisition of riches and the fulfillment of material desires.

The magical art of communicating with the dead, outlined in a ritual involving specific times (Christmas midnight mass), locations (cemeteries), and tools (grave earth, bones of the deceased) to evoke shades for information.

A complex alchemical recipe described under the misnomer 'Composition of Death,' which is, in fact, a detailed process for transmuting base metals into gold, involving various minerals (copper, arsenic), acids, plant extracts, and a specific heating process, implying a form of chemical magic for material gain.

practical_system.description: The practical system of the Grand Grimoire is a highly structured form of ritual magic designed to compel infernal spirits, primarily Lucifuge Rofocale, to manifest and grant material wealth or other specific desires. It is predicated on a Faustian exchange—a pact negotiated between the Karcist (operator) and the spirit, often involving a commitment of the practitioner's soul or a symbolic offering. The system demands meticulous preparation, including periods of purification, precise construction and consecration of magical tools and spaces, and powerful invocations that paradoxically leverage divine authority (through sacred names) to control demonic entities. The magic is explicitly operative, focusing on tangible results rather than spiritual development.
tools: Verga Fulminante (Fulminant Rod): Hazelnut wood, steel tips, consecrated.
Cabalistic Circle: Goat skin, four nails, amatita stone (hematite), divine and protective inscriptions.
Amatita (Hematite): A bloodstone used for drawing symbols and as a protective amulet.
Virgin Kid/Goat: Sacrificial animal for the ritual offering.
Blessed Candles and Vervain Crowns: Used within the cabalistic circle for illumination and consecration.
Willow Charcoal, Wine Spirit, Frankincense, Camphor: Incense and burning materials for the ritual space.
Virgin Parchment and Practitioner's Blood: For writing and signing the pact with the spirit.
English Needle: Used in a spell for protection against cold steel.
Black Cat, New Cauldron, Mirror, Flint, Charcoal: Components for the invisibility ritual.
Polished Steel Plate, Dove Blood: Materials for constructing Solomon's Divinatory Mirror.
Gold Ring with Diamond, Human Hairs (from practitioner and desired person): Used in love spells.
Specific Plant Materials: Walnut, marjoram, myrtle, vervain (for dancing spell); fern (for speaking with spirits on St. John's Eve).
rituals: Purification Period: A 'quarter of the moon' period involving dietary restrictions, sexual abstinence, and specific prayers to Adonay, Eloim, and Jehova before meals to ensure the operator's ritual purity and divine favor.

Construction and Consecration of the Fulminant Rod: A hazelnut branch, 19.5 inches long and forked, cut at sunrise with a blood-stained knife. Its tips are armed with steel and magnetized, and it's imbued with power through invocations to biblical and magical figures (Jacob, Moses, Joshua, Samson). This rod is used to strike and compel spirits.

Construction of the Cabalistic Circle: A protective circle drawn on a goat skin (from a sacrificed virgin kid), fastened with four nails, inscribed with a triangle, specific letters, and the name †JHS† using an amatita stone. It is set up with blessed candles, vervain crowns, a vessel of burning willow charcoal, wine spirit, frankincense, and camphor.
Sacrifice of a Virgin Kid: A ritualistic offering to secure divine favor and facilitate spirit manifestation. The skin is used for the circle, and the ashes are scattered with specific prayers.

Multiple Invocations and Adjurations: A series of escalating commands to Emperor Lucifer and his ministers (especially Lucifuge Rofocale), utilizing powerful divine names (Adonay, Eloim, Jehova, Agla, etc.) and threatening torment with the fulminant rod to force appearance and obedience.

Pact Negotiation: Direct dialogue with the evoked spirit (Lucifuge Rofocale) to establish terms for obtaining treasures or other desires. The spirit often demands the operator's body and soul (initially for 50 years, later negotiated to 20 years or a consecrated coin), which is formalized by writing and signing a pact on virgin parchment with the practitioner's blood.

Spirit Dismissal: A specific conjuration to formally dismiss the spirit, expressing satisfaction with the pact and warning against any failure to uphold its terms, reiterating the threat of the fulminant rod.
Thanksgiving Prayer: A post-ritual prayer to God, expressing gratitude for the successful operation and protection, and seeking inspiration for charity with the acquired wealth.

Necromancy Ritual: A detailed process for communicating with the dead, involving attending Christmas midnight mass, visiting a cemetery, scattering grave earth, and manipulating bones of the deceased while uttering specific invocations to evoke shades.

Solomon's Mirror Divination: A 14-to-48-day ritual to create a divinatory mirror from a polished steel plate, inscribed with divine names using dove's blood, and consecrated with invocations to the angel Anael for revealing hidden knowledge.

relevant_quotes.text: IL GRAND GRIMOIRE con LA GRANDE CLAVICOLA DI SALOMONE
Il Grand Grimoire con la Clavicola di Salomone Edizione agosto 2002 by L'Arcano Incantatore

LE GRAND GRIMOIRE, AVEC LA GRANDE CLAVICULE DE SALOMON, Et la MAGIE NOIRE, ou les FORCES, infernales du Grand Agrippa, pour découvrir tous les trésors cachés, et se faire obeir par tous les Esprits suivie de tous les Arts magiques.

L'uomo che geme sotto il peso importuno dei pregiudizii e delle persuasioni, a stento potrà persuadersi che mi è stato possibile d'inchiudere in questo piccolo libro l'estratto di più di venti volumi...

<< Io ti offro questa vittima, o grande Adonay, Eloim, Ariel, e Jehova, e questo in onore, gloria e potenza del tuo essere superiore ed a tutti gli spiriti, degnati, o grande Adonay, di aggradirla. Amen ».

Io ti comando e scongiuro imperatore Lucifero da parte del gran Dio vivente, per la potenza di Emanuele suo figlio, unico tuo padrone e mio, e per la virtù del suo sangue prezioso che ha sparso per liberare gli uomini dalle tue catene, io ti ordino di abbandonare la tua dimora in qualunque parte del mondo che esso sia, giurandoti che io non ti concedo un momento di riposo, ma che tu vieni a parlarmi subito con intellegibil voce; o se non puoi venire in persona, mandami il tuo messaggiero Astaroth in sembianza umana senza rumore e cattivi odori, senza di che io vado a percuoter te e tuta la tua generazione colla verga fulminante infino al profondo degli abissi; e sarà colla potenza di queste grandi parole della clavicola per Adonay, Eloim,
Io non ti posso accordare quello che tu mi dimandi, se non a questa condizione e a niun altra. Che tu ti doni a me da qui a cinquant'anni per far del tuo corpo ed anima quello che mi piacerà.
Io prometto al gran Lucifuge di ricompensarlo in vent'anni di tutti i tesori ch'egli mi darà. In fede di che io mi sono segnato.
COMPOSIZIONE DI MORTE, O COMPOSIZIONE DELLA PIETRA FILOSOFALE.

Prendete un gatto nero, comprate una caldaja nuova, uno specchio, un acciarino, una pietra focaja con l'esca a carboni, osservando d'andare a prender l'acqua in punto a mezzanotte ad una fontana. Dopo accendete il vostro fuoco, mettete il gatto nella caldaja e tenete il coperchio colla mano sinistra senza muoversi per qualsiasi rumore che sentirete dietro le spalle: dopo che lo avete fatto bollire per ventiquattr'ore lo depoditerete in un piatto nuovo. Getterete la carne sopra la spalla sinistra, dicendo: accipe quod tibi do et nihil amplius. Poi mettete le ossa uno ad uno sotto i denti alla parte sinistra, guardandovi nello specchio, e quando non saranno buoni

critical_analysis.relevance: The Grand Grimoire is a foundational text within the grimoire tradition of Western Esotericism, particularly significant for its explicit focus on infernal pacts and material acquisition. It stands out for its pragmatic approach to magic, offering concrete methods for compelling powerful demons for wealth and various practical applications. Its purported Solomonic origin, though debated, imbues it with historical weight and places it within a long lineage of ceremonial magic. The text reflects a shift towards more utilitarian magical goals compared to purely spiritual or protective aims found in other Solomonic grimoires, making it a key document for understanding the development of 'black magic' perceptions and practices.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of practicing magicians, occultists, and serious students of Western Esotericism and demonology. Its detailed instructions cater to those interested in operative ritual magic, particularly for establishing pacts with infernal entities to achieve worldly gains. Historians of esotericism and religious studies scholars would also find it valuable for understanding the historical context of magical practices, perceptions of evil, and the Faustian bargain trope. Given its explicit content, it targets individuals comfortable with darker aspects of occult lore and ceremonial evocation.
